facts: Honey can last for thousands of years without spoiling because it has very little water and is naturally acidic.
Popcorn kernels pop because water inside turns to steam and bursts the hard shell when heated.
Bananas are berries in botanical terms, but strawberries are not.
Brown eggs and white eggs taste the same, and the shell color mostly depends on the breed of the chicken.
Chocolate is made from roasted cacao beans, which come from pods that grow on cacao trees.
Yogurt is made when helpful bacteria ferment milk sugars into lactic acid, which makes it thick and tangy.
The green color in many plants comes from chlorophyll, which helps them capture sunlight to make food.
